edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj

Class WorldItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj.WorldItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Locatable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Briefcase, Camo, ExtraBullet, Invincibility, NightVision, Radar

    public abstract class WorldItem
extends java.lang.Object
implements Locatable, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents all the items found in the game like the power ups and the briefcase. This abstract class holds all the necessary attributes for the actual items' classes extending this class, like name, a char that represents the item, and the grid for the items' locations.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • apply

        public abstract void apply(Player player)
        This method applies the item to the character. It is abstract so that it can be applied uniquely to the different classes that extend this abstract class.

      • getASCIIDisplayCharacter

        public char getASCIIDisplayCharacter(boolean visible)
        Description copied from interface: Locatable
        Returns the ASCII character used to display this object when the game is played in the console. Whether the tile is visible to the player can be specified. Examples: 'A','r','*',' '.
        Specified by:
        getASCIIDisplayCharacter in interface Locatable
        Parameters:
        visible - whether the player can see the grid square that contains this object
        Returns:
        the character used to display this object, or null if this object should not be displayed

      • getUnicodeDisplayCharacter

        public char getUnicodeDisplayCharacter(boolean visible)
        Description copied from interface: Locatable
        Returns the Unicode character used to display this object when the game is played in the console. Whether the tile is visible to the player can be specified. Examples: '♕','♿','⚑','♦'.
        Specified by:
        getUnicodeDisplayCharacter in interface Locatable
        Parameters:
        visible - whether the player can see the grid square that contains this object
        Returns:
        the character used to display this object, or null if this object should not be displayed
